summary: This is the original sealed indictment filed in the Southern District of New York against Jeffrey Epstein, charging him with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors. It details a multi-year scheme from approximately 2002 to 2005 where Epstein sexually exploited dozens of minor girls at his residences in Manhattan and Palm Beach, using a network of employees and victim-recruiters.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors for exploiting dozens of girls as young as 14 from approximately 2002 to 2005.
Epstein operated a network using employees (Employee-1, Employee-2, Employee-3) to schedule encounters and victim-recruiters to bring new minors to his residences in New York and Florida.
The indictment specifies three minor victims (Minor Victim-1, -2, -3) who were repeatedly abused and recruited others, with some explicitly telling Epstein their age.
Epstein's New York residence at 9 East 71st Street, owned by Maple, Inc., is listed as specific property subject to forfeiture.
The scheme involved paying victims hundreds of dollars in cash per encounter and paying recruiters for each new girl they brought.
